s.text: Since she has not, until this moment, shown interest one way or another in her inherited religion, her sudden zeal to abandon it seems clumsy on Begley's part.
What mysteriously disappeared, from one book to the next, is a sense of the perilous.
The Jamesian upholstery is ripped off Begley's prose, and we are down to springs and horsehair: "I haven't seen your breasts.

The pair do not look Jewish, and this, combined with Tania's charm, enables them to evade capture, even as they live openly yards from the Warsaw ghetto.
Nonetheless, they are in great peril, and are hiding from that peril.
It is difficult not to detect an autobiographical note in his heroes' struggle to control inner distress and bury forgotten memories.

It is difficult not to detect an autobiographical note in his heroes' struggle to control inner distress and bury forgotten memories.
The obviousness of Charlotte and Jon's evil leaches the force from the story.
But his latest novels do more than just showcase it; they become its victims.
